intro: Decazesia, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Decazesia thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable species for ecological studies.
